content.label: As a fan of Framed, Framed 2 is an excellent prequel that blends seamlessly with the original and moves the story along nicely. As with the first game, the puzzles are not impossible and, for the most part, are very clever. The plot twists keep you on your toes, just like a film noire movie is supposed to. Can't wait for the next offering from down under. Two thumbs up.

This game has possibly the most beautiful graphics I've ever seen. I don't usually write reviews but I had to put that out there. As a graphic designer myself, I'm very impressed at how much work was put into this.
That being said, it is a bit short. It took me only about an hour to get through it. That's the only reason I put 4 stars (I wanted to rate it 4.5 stars but it doesn't let you use half stars). Of course, with it's stunning panels, it probably took months, if not years, to finish this. Which slightly makes up for the length of the game. 
But overall, it's a work of art. I look forward to the next one!
I'm almost crying. The ending is so sad.  Best game ever!

I love this game!  The developers didn't an excellent job of weaving the story and gameplay together.  Such a beautiful, immersive world.  My only criticism would be the length.  It could be a touch longer for the price.  That being said, I highly recommend both Framed 2 and it's predecessor.

title.label: The game was a little short

content.label: Although it was a bit short, I liked it. (Part number 3 please)

It was fun while it lasted... 
I finished rather fast
So if it had more levels i would have given it a full 5 stars. Fun but not worth the $5 due to lack of levels the game provides.

title.label: Lame.  Not a puzzle game.  A guessing game

content.label:
The concept is fun.  The artwork is great. But after a while the "puzzles" devolve into mere guessing games.  Illogical and random unpredictable "solutions". 

I deleted it. Not worth the time.

some of the puzzles are very good but I couldn't believe it ended so abruptly. For the price, one should receive the same game but twice as long.

Bummer !
I didn't feel like it was not worth 5 bucks. It kept me entertained for a while. I was sad at the ending 😔. Nevertheless a great game.

I like the graphics and music, but like the first one, it is short. I also think it shouldn't be offered for $5 and should be cheaper, even though it's a nice game. It has one of the best story plots I have ever seen, and has a very shocking but nice ending
Very innovative yet extremely short
Too short! This comment is longer than this sequel. *sigh*
I don't understand why there is no control to turn off the music within the game. But if my phone is set to silent the game must follow this. I'm sure the Apple guidelines do not allow this.

title.label: Nice game but a little short

content.label:
It's beautiful like its predecessor, it is a bit harder than original Framed. I like the story and it merges the Framed 2 to the beginning of the Framed 1 in the end but the story lacks in some cases I think, for instance the girl in original Framed poisoned the man who recruit him to assassinate the man with mustache in cafe. The ending is sad but story is totally beautiful.
I wish there were a pause button to reorganize the frames.
I'm looking forward for Framed 3, hope developers produce that.I also like the quality of Loveshack games, in past 3 or 4 years they introduced just 2 games with gorgeous quality. Hope part 3 doesn't take 3 years to become completed.
More frustrating and seemed shorter than the original

title.label: It's really not very good. Sorry.

content.label: I like indie games and sympathize with their makers. It makes me happy if an indie game becomes successful. That said, this one needs a lot of work in the concept department. Puzzles like this one become very boring and unsatisfying when they don't stick to strict logical rules. This game kind of forces you to accept its makers' random ideas on how the logic of the scenes is supposed to work. It becomes very frustrating quickly, because there are no clear rules about how the mechanics operate. The same move that creates one outcome once, leads to a completely different one at other times, based only on what "they" need. The idea of swopping out the frames of a comic strip to change its outcome is brilliant. But you're forced to rely on trial and error endlessly, until you happen upon the solution the game wants from you. It's hard, often impossible, to memorize what happens in many of the frames. Often, the frames, before you hit the play button, are too similar and are difficult or impossible to tell apart. Success, when it finally comes, doesn't give you the satisfaction of having figured it out, it just confirms that you finally followed the idiosyncratic rules of the game and its makers.

I think there's a glitch on level 16. The characters disappeared 4 or 5 cards in and I can't progress. I'm currently running the latest version 10.3.2 on my iPad. Restarting it did not fix the problem.
They fixed all the problems in the first one! This game is AWESOME!
Really genius game, unlike any other games out there. Only complaint is the same I had with the first - I wish it were longer.
Probably would not have spent the money if I realized it was that short.

I'm glad I played the first game👢
I FINISHED IT IT WAS BEAUTIFUL!!! EVERYTHING LINKS TOGETHER AND THE PUZZLES AREN'T TOO EASY! I LOVE THIS GAME! IT'S A MASTERPIECE.

title.label: Great new features and intriguing story

content.label: As for the predecessor of this game, Framed had some unique and challenging levels that were a bit difficult to find the solution to, but some of the solutions are now so creative! Now there's more in this game where you can collect photos?! This lengthens the game, even if you have completed the story, there's always something else to earn. I like that. Shocking ending by the way! Framed 2 is a great game.

I enjoyed the first game, and the second does not disappoint. Fun and somewhat challenging puzzles as the game progresses. The music sets the tone like a Pink Panther episode. 

I am fine paying $4.99. Im really over games that are free to download but offer in game purchases. Id rather pay the developers for their time and effort (3 years to make?). 

I think this game is just what every game should be - enjoyable.

As with its predecesor, the gameplay is great, imaginative and unique. However, many of the levels are mere storytelling; others are just introductory/tutorial. The real levels are way too few for the price. The game needed at least twice as many to justify its price. So, wait until the price drops below $2.49 to buy. At $4.99 it's twice as expensive as it should be.

Cool concept. Great story. It was difficult, but not too difficult (I got stumped twice). The only reason I give it 4 stars is because of how short it is, making it (in my opinion) worth $3 (maybe $4) at the most, definitely not $5. All around good game though.
So good. Worth every penny. I'd love too pay for $5 even it's short.
There under 30 levels, is a very easy game not work 4.99

This game is incredibly unique & enjoyable. It's better than the first game (Framed) w/ many new challenges & obstacles that make the gameplay very fun! It's certainly worth checking out because there isn't anything else like it available on the app store.
This game is definitely worth getting if you have a few dollars lying around. Was just disappointed that the game is kinda to short for my liking. Definitely looking forward to the next one

Overall, it's a fun game, and an interesting concept. I love the animations as well. 

I deducted 2 stars because the developers don't seem to understand that some people DON'T want to hear the music all the time. I have the hard switch in the off position, and the game should honor that, but it should also have a setting somewhere where you can disable the sound. The music isn't even that amazing... why force it?

I really like this game for many reasons: it helps fill in the holes of the other game's story, and it's pure genius. I've never seen anything like it, and the puzzles are very unique. Worth the 5$, I think. By the way, can you add more entries to the series? I'd be willing to pay...

I really liked but it was soooooo much shorter than Framed and also Framed had the do over ending which was pretty cool.  Love the story line but don't kill the guy!!! I just think it should be less that 5 dollars for that short of a game.  But it was awesome and i can't wait for the third!!!

I adore both of these games! They are gorgeous and the puzzles are really interesting. 
My main problem is it's a bit short for $5. 

Thank you for your time.
Very nice graphic and details! It is very fun to play with an interesting story! Can't wait for more!
I love this game . I played framed 1 and I completed it, but on this game I am confused I am stuck on the part where he is in the box and he trying to escape the guards, am stuck please help !:(
I think 2 is greater than 1,l'm very satisfied ,thanks really,developers

Cleared the first one a few months ago and loved it. Been half way through now and I really liked the new cutscenes. Very interesting game, totally worth paying for.

Update: cleared it. The ending suggests that there will be FRAMED 3.

title.label: Won't allow me to go further

content.label: If you are stuck at the part with the code and it says your are right than starts know that is part of the game
Slow to start. Just moving frames around is not all that exciting.

When I get to a particular part in the game where the correct code is 3764 the door light turns green telling me I've solved the puzzle correctly based off of the flashing numbers through the glass in the depiction on the right side of the screen. But a drawing/picture appears soon after completing the puzzle and every time I click out of it, the game no longer allows that password as a correct answer after setting me back to the solving scenario. If I am doing something wrong please tell me. But if this is a glitch for the device I am using (iPhone 7) then I am sincerely disappointed. It's a $5 app and I usually don't pay for games. ：（

One of my biggest pet peeves with games/apps is when I open the app with my silence switch turned on, and the game still plays audio! Often times I will open a game up in bed, and I do not want to wake my wife. It's such a small and easy thing for a developer to implement, and is a part of Apple's Human Interface Guidelines! Please fix!
I like it !

Great game so far, but once I get to the door that needs a combination, I can't continue. I type in the correct number and get a green light but then a drawing pops up and when I click away and I can't continue!
Played framed 1 years age, love it. This one is even more interesting and hard. Amazing game.
Make another make another!

title.label: Once again, awesome-slick art style with clever puzzles

content.label: Some still may complain too short, but it's still a very well crafted game that brings you in for the immersion - even if it can be beat in one sitting...I liked that they added more cutscenes this time around to tie the story better together and there were some nifty new puzzle components as well...I would have liked more collectibles to get throughout each level - but hey, at least they added it in the first place.

I been checking the App Store just waiting for a sequel and BAM! Here it is! I played the first one twice. Such a unique game from the music to the concept. I haven't played 2 yet but it's getting g 5 stars just cause!! CANNOT WAIT to jump into Framed 2!!
This is just an amazing game. 10/10. If you get this game, you will enjoy it.
Loved the first one, second one is even better!!!
